The SF Token Kai was the best! I purchased the new, 2-vol. set of Sue-
Koto=
. I can allready tell it's going to be very educational. I went 
to all the=
 lectures - the Kodogu & Tsuba lectures (by Gilbert & 
Robson) were the bes=
t. Benson lectured on Bizen swords and I was able 
to admire and study 5 of=
 them. 

This is my second time to attend this show. I decided to have my o=
wn 
table and actually sold some of the wonderful Tsuba that I own (I own 
=
too many!). I was very glad to meet Robert Haynes. He is so happy to 
answe=
r any and all questions that anyone ask's. I ask him plenty and 
was educat=
ed in the process. 

The only head-ache occured coming and going at the SF =
airport. I had 
a Security Weapon case to carry 2 swords - allmost lost, re=
peatedly 
searched, I could go on and on. 

I have a question..........What=
 is the web-site address for the NTHK? 
I am contemplating joining. I hear =
they have a good 'novice' course 
about Nihonto.

Thanks,
Elliott
